column8: Performative staff, the quintessential passive-aggressive cool kids manager, speaks to Latino employees like they're dumb and have no senses. Yay, how liberal!

I go to this place often to grab some oysters. Usually have a great experience. Whoever was the hostess tonight made me never want to return. I walk in at 10:25 to be seated and am told their kitchen closes at 10:30. Which is odd cause I've never been told this especially cause I only order oysters and a few drink around this time and day. Needless to say I won't be back.

I am still reeling from shock of how horribly myself and my family were treated. I, visibly pregnant, was seated at a table with a bench on one side and 2 chairs on the other. My 2yo and 5yo were both sitting with me on the bench side waiting for my husband to arrive. There were 3 other similar tables next to us, all still unseated. The hostess kindly brought us crayons for my children to color on the paper laid across the table. My daughter was coloring, never straying once from our table. My son was guardian of the crayons. On three occasions, my *near 2yo* screamed loudly "MINE!" when my daughter went for a crayon. I am well aware this is less than ideal. It is a phase he is in, screeching any time he is excited or mad or expressing emotions. Before and after each of those moments, he was calm and happy and just fine. Each time he did it, I did my best to get him to stop immediately. We had been there all but 10 minutes. The manager, Christopher Fischbach, approached me and said "You are going to have to reign this in." I asked "excuse me?" And he said "you are going to have to reign this in. We can't have your children running around and the screaming will have to stop." I replied that my daughter hadn't left the table once and then asked how he suggest I stop my not yet 2yo son from screaming?" He said he didn't know. I asked "and what if I can't? Will we be escorted out?" And he said "if it is excessive, maybe so. We have to seat these other tables."At this point I was so incredulous, I could not believe this was being said to a paying customer, let alone the fact that a child was being targeted. I asked if this was routine for them, he did not reply and he walked away. I still cannot believe this happened. I am appalled. I am ashamed to say that we stayed, but I refuse to be bullied. Yeah, they got my money, but I have my dignity. And I hope Christopher (who, no, does not have children of his own) treats families trying their absolute best with the respect they deserve moving forward. He was a pretty massive disappointment to humanity tonight.Do yourself a favor and don't waste your money here. The food was not remotely worth what they lack entirely in service.

Transphobic environment. As you've probably gathered, my partner is a transgender woman and I fully support/love her, we were eating at the Old Spaghetti Factory in Southcenter when my partner said she felt someone staring at her, I was going to assure her that kno one was staring, however, I was appalled to see this kid working there standing in the kitchen entrance pointing at her, I stared the kid down until he walked away. I immediately asked for the manager, the manager who came over to help us was completely drunk, he asked us if we were sure he was pointing at us, and he offered to pay for our food. This place is a whole bundle of bad memories for us now. Time to go to Cheesecake Factory instead.

No sign out front. Just a door painted pink. When we finally found it, it wasn't open yet but someone came to the door and said that if we wanted to wait until they opened in 20 minutes we probably couldn't get seated right away because we didn't have reservations. Kind of a snotty attitude as well. So we just walked away.

The food and service doesn't matter for this review. Our waitress wore a t-shirt that said "My Body, My Choice, My Abortion". I don't care what your beliefs on this topic are. Any establishment with such little class and decency that would allow an employee to dress like this isn't worthy of visiting. Shameful.
This is the worst restaurant I have ever been too. I would give them negative stars if I could.
If I could give thus place zero stars I would. They are racist!!!!DO NOT EAT HERE!!!!!
I went there and I noticed the door. IT WASN'T PINK! Why?! Please paint it pink! Never go here again if they don't paint this door!
The only restaurant I have ever walked out of-TWICE

This is my favorite restaurant and my family and I have spent a lot of time here. Tonight sept 15th 2018 we called and were told we couldn't make a reservation and to just come in. We arrived at 6:50 and were turned away saying that there is no space for us ( there was plenty of space as we could see) We were told there was a burlesque showing going on later in the evening in the back. The lack of communication makes me never want to come here again.

Arrived to the restaurant with reservations to find the menu so offensive with anti-Trump item names. Way to offend patrons who want to support your restaurant. Your employees are mandated to obey the owners political views - no thanks. Never will we support your business. Service was terrible once we expressed being offended.

We made reservations through open table and received excellent seating in the dining room. I have been to the pink door for many many years and for many occasions, however on this particular occasion we were celebrating 2 birthdays. We enjoyed a very nice lunch for two, linguine vongole and the squid ink pasta seafood special.The awkward moment arrived when the server brought us an empty plate with two birthday candles absent of anything except the two candles.We felt as though he presented an "empty" birthday wish. I am still dumbfounded by the gesture. Honestly I would have preferred no recognition rather than the empty plate presentation. That was the one star reception we received. My friend had flown in from San Francisco for this luncheon and it was immeasurably disappointing.
Rude Manager! Dont waste your time going there. Manager (blonde woman) was very rude to us.

Posting political views on your menu is completely unacceptable. The first thing I looked at was the drink menu, only to come across a drink called "Dump Trump" I find this offensive and arrogant. I will not be back nor will I recommend The Pink Door to others.

$20 per person for "Theatre Seating" for their Burlesque show means cramming chairs in around the dining tables. They wouldn't take a reservation for dinner, but made us prepay to sit next to the kitchen for the show. I feel like a pauper in the Kings court.

The place is cute! The trapeeze performer is great. The problem was the cost of the food for the quantity and quality. We really went to see the perfomace thinking it would be a fun way to spend dinner. Well the performace is five minutes at best, every 30-45 minutes so don't go for that. The food was way over priced. I spent $44.00 for a small bowl of (premade) gluten free pasta with a bland cream sauce, a butterscotch pudding (which was pretty good) and a glass of water-yes $44!!! . Since I had to eat GF I didn't get bread unless I wanted to pay $3 more for Udi's bread. There were no dinner salads, veggies, meat for my dish or anything else. I hate the Italian Denny's (Olive Garden) but have to say I have had better meals there and for a better price. Felt a bit duped by the allure of a cool performace which is the only reason I was willing to spend that kind of money on pasta only to find out it the performance wasn't really part of the ambiance. Very disappointing.
****worst food poisoning of my life****

We planned our meal two months in advance, reserved a table, and hoped to top off the last night of our Seattle vacation with an excellent view, meal and drinks.We were seated on the patio, jammed into a corner but jutting out into the walkway, where we were jostled by staff and other diners. We ordered sodas while taking a moment to look at the wine menu, and decided to share an order of the calamari with spinach. This was okay, a bit overcooked and chewy, but we had high hopes for the meal - I ordered linguine with clams, and my husband ordered clams and mussels.I had one bite of my pasta with clams, and couldn't eat anymore. The pasta was overcooked, but all of that was masked by the amount of sodium in the "broth" - you could taste nothing BUT salt, as though a cup of it had been poured into the cooking liquid. The acidity burned my tongue and scoured the inside of my mouth. I couldn't taste or eat properly for two days afterward. My husband's clams and mussels had no seasoning or taste, other than that of steamed and overcooked seafood. No garlic, wine, herbs or anything else. It was as if they'd steamed the shellfish and dumped them in the bowl. Also, no pasta or other sides were served with that dish: $26 or so for a bowl of flavorless steamed mussels and clams. We declined to order something else, and asked for our check. This was the only time in our lives that we've ever walked out of a restaurant. Although the manager comped our soda and calamari, we left a comparable amount on the table for the waitress and staff. We figured they shouldn't be left without the tip they'd have received had the chef and kitchen staff not put out such an embarassing "meal". We spent an hour trying to find another restaurant that was open in the area after 9 PM, which oddly enough is not easy to do, especially as we'd walked from our rental to The Pink Door.As far as ambience and staff: the greeter and our waitress were very nice. The place was okay, but other than some cute decoration and a good band, it wasn't exceptional - certainly not enough to balance out the mediocre starter and inedible meal. I can honestly say I'd not recommend this restaurant to anyone.
Poor form to not warn people about the trapeze act that will take place right over their table.
Mediocre Tiramisu

The first time I went to Seattle, my coworker suggested I try The Pink Door. After reading the rave reviews, I was excited to check it out. I ordered the seasonal Love Fest drink and the spinach pasta lasagna. Both were absolutely delicious--the best lasagna and cocktail I've ever had. Despite it being pretty packed and not having a reservation, the host kindly offered me a seat at the bar. I didn't mind since I was dining solo. The bartender was very friendly and made me laugh as we chatted about San Francisco, my hometown. The ambiance was charming, with a dark yet cozy interior and live music, which was a lovely bonus.Fast forward to my second visit, which was during my birthday weekend on a solo trip to Seattle. I decided to have my birthday dinner at The Pink Door. Unfortunately, this experience was vastly different. I arrived around 8 PM, close to the last call for dinner, so the restaurant was quite empty. Despite this, the host insisted I sit at the bar again, which felt odd since there were plenty of empty tables and I wanted a more traditional dining experience for my birthday. I ordered an orange cocktail (can't remember the name), and while the waitress carded me, she didn't acknowledge my birthday at all. Additionally, my water cup was only refilled by a passing busser rather than my waitress, who seemed inattentive. The lasagna was just as delicious as before, but the service this time was extremely disappointing. It felt like they weren't interested in providing good service during the last call.The food at The Pink Door is amazing, but the service can be hit or miss. They definitely need to improve their service, especially for customers who dine during quieter times.
Have eaten here before and it really good food but the service is terrible.
It's awesome! The food and the atmosphere are so good. Definitely will be there again!
Too pricey for food. Good for decor, waterfront view and live music

The only reason I'm giving this place 2 stars is because the food was excellent. Our server and the overall service on the other hand was less than subpar and rude at times. I came here with my girlfriend knowing I was going to spend a few hundred dollars and we were taken to our seat and immediately told by our young male server that when he is in our presence we have to put our masks on which I am 100% on board with preventative measures regarding covid however when im in a restaurant sat across from one person while our server is 6ft apart it didn't make sense but we went with it. Putting his unapproachable attitude to one side, we literally had to wait close to 20 minutes to even order our first drink which again showed either his lack of understanding in the customer service industry or lack of respect to his patrons. I know he isn't a true representation of this establishment because of the many other great reviews but when youre spending hundred of dollars on a meal, the environment and service should be a solid part of the package and this was lacking. I have been to nearly 8 restaurants over my vacation here in Seattle and this guy ruined what would be an amazing 5 star place. Would not recommend to friends or family.

The food quality is below average. Nothing special here. The experience is all right. The view sitting outside is good.
Didn't live up to what I had been told. Service was horrible.
Entree amount is more like appetizer

To be honest, I wasn't that impressed with The Pink Door. My wife and I were really looking forward to going and we thought it was a bit of a classy place, judging by the website. Turns out, it's not. Luckily for us, we got to sit inside, but the tables outside all had plastic picnic type table cloths. The restaurant is located in an alley and it fits in with the Public Market scene, but definitely not with the classy scene that it portrays on the website. The food wasn't that great either, ESPECIALLY for the price we paid. I had the spaghetti, which came with no garlic bread or anything and my wife had the steak, which was more bone than actual meat. The main reason we wanted to go was for the trapeze artist, which was supposed to be performing from 6:30-9PM, so I made our reservation for 6:30PM. The whole hour and a half that we were there, she performed for 2 songs. That's it! The trapeze artist isn't something that should be advertised if she isn't going to perform. Overall, I definitely won't be returning to The Pink Door. It's just not worth the money. It's nothing spectacular.

LOVE THE DECK. If you cant sit outside on a warm summer day its really not worth going. The manager always seems a little frazzled and the staff isnt much better. Just not the greatest service or food.

The servers are pretty rude and mostly nonexistent and heaven forbid you have a question on the menu. The food was adequate and terribly overpriced. I would have enjoyed Olive Garden more for 1/2 the price. Don't waste your money on this pretentious "destination" restaurant.
The price of everything was too expensive for the service and the portions we received.
There is a lot to love about this place! It's a beautiful restaurant with great food and great drinks. Be sure to get a Negroni from Matt!

It's really a cool place and awesome staff! I'd definitely suggest going when they have live entertainment (after 7pm), though. Without the entertainment, it's just an okay place with slightly overpriced food and a quirky vibe.
Ambiance is cute and the staff was polite and helpful, but that's kind of all that I enjoyed. When you pay $120 for two entrees, a side of meatballs
the back with some nice views (of the Ferris wheel from one side). While on the other
My friend gets a reservation every 1st of the month at midnight because the reservations book quickkk.

It was okay. Happy hour was pretty good, $3 pizza and wine was cheap. But the regular menu was just meh! The Linguine Alle Vongole and the Pizza Bianca were bombed though. They tasted Italian AF, but then again, I ain't been to Italy, so can't say much. I wouldn't go there for dinner though. The trapeze thingy was kinda weird for me. Their outdoor seating area is dope, especially during summer. Plus, they have live bands sometimes, so it's not all bad.
Great restaurant, very knowledgeable and approachable staff. Very helpful with the clientele. Excellent catch of the day. Chapeau.

The Pink Door is a decent restaurant with some hits and misses. The lasagna was enjoyable, offering a good flavor. On the other hand, the fish of the day dish didn't live up to expectations, lacking execution on flavors. Additionally, it was disappointing that there were no enticing non-alcoholic dessert options to choose from. Overall, it was an average dining experience.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at The Pink Door, an Italian restaurant nestled in a charming corner of the city. While my experience had its highlights, there were a few aspects that left me wanting more.Let's start with the positives. The service at The Pink Door was exemplary. From the moment I stepped through the pink-hued entrance, the staff greeted me with warm smiles and made me feel welcome. They were attentive, knowledgeable, and ensured that my dining experience was smooth and enjoyable. Kudos to the staff for their exceptional service!The drink selection at The Pink Door was a true delight. The bar is well-stocked and the mixologists behind it know their craft. I tried a couple of their signature cocktails, and each one was expertly crafted, bursting with unique flavors and beautifully presented. If you're a fan of creative libations, The Pink Door will not disappoint.Now, onto the food. While the dishes at The Pink Door were undeniably well-prepared, I found them to be on the pricier side. It's true that quality ingredients and a skilled culinary team come at a cost, but I couldn't help but feel that the prices were a tad steep for what was served.Specifically, the pasta, often hailed as an Italian staple, left me somewhat underwhelmed. While it was cooked to a perfect al dente texture, the flavors fell slightly short of my expectations. The dishes lacked that extra oomph that elevates a good pasta to a memorable one. Perhaps a bit more attention to seasoning and innovative flavor combinations would enhance the overall dining experience.Despite these shortcomings, The Pink Door does possess its fair share of merits. The attentive service and the remarkable drinks are definite highlights that shouldn't be overlooked. However, I would encourage the restaurant to refine their flavors and consider adjusting their pricing to offer better value for the culinary experience they aim to provide.In summary, The Pink Door is a decent Italian restaurant with good service and amazing drinks. While the food may be a bit expensive and the pasta lacks a little bit of flavor, it's still a place worth visiting if you're in the mood for a charming atmosphere and attentive service.

The ambiance is amazing and so is the service. I feel like they need to up their game with vegan stuff especially being this upscale restaurant in Seattle. I tried their only vegan spaghetti and I hate to say that it was tasteless I have been to the pink door before when I wasn't vegan and loved it. I would love to see if they up their Vegan game and pull us, vegans, toward them

Been to Seattle many times and I can't believe it was my first time eating here! The food was good, nothing memorable but good, I thought it was a bit overpriced but when you have a huge line at the door I suppose they can charge whatever they want. The service was a great, very nice waiter - great experience overall - I would recommend and go back.

Been to Seattle many times and I can't believe it was my first time eating here! The food was good, nothing memorable but good, I thought it was a bit overpriced but when you have a huge line at the door I suppose they can charge whatever they want. The service was a great, very nice waiter - great experience overall - I would recommend and go back.
I think the food here is good, I feel satisfied but not the service.Yet thanks The Pink Door!
Was really good. Dessert was ok, I should just skip it next time. Drinks and service was great. I will come back again next time for more:)

Been to Seattle many times and I can't believe it was my first time eating here! Food was good, nothing memorable but good, I thought it's a bit overpriced but when you have a huge line at the door I suppose they can charge whatever they want. Service was great, very nice waiter - great experience overall - I would recommend and go back
This would be a fun place, but the staff can't get you seated timely or even get you a reservation within the week for a party of five or more.
Fun place and good food. worth a trip
I've been here a handful of times, and honestly I think it's overrated. In my opinion, there are so many other great options for Italian food.
Italian food and wine is one of those things you really cant live without if you really think aboutit. Stop in and check these guys out!
Delicious Risotto and fabulous burlesque show. We didn't have a reservation and rolled the dice on getting in. I called right before we headed out and they were luckily able to find us a table.
Italian food and wine is one of those things you really cant live without if you really think aboutit. Stop in and check these guys out!
Almost every great food, terrible service, time. If you want a little better service it is better to go to another place.
Great when you walk in but the other side is very touristy.
Okay food. Okay experience. Will try them again to make sure it wasn't just a fluke. My girlfriend thought they were good though, so that's why I'm giving them another shot :)
Good food, clean restaurant. Good experience.

Can't ever get into this crazy place- there is ALWAYS a line and a wait. When I finally got to try it, it was just okay. The food was to be expected, and our server seemed too busy to really pay attention.

We were really looking forward to this restaurant based on recommendations we'd received and Yelp reviews we'd read.There is no sign, just a pink door. The interior is fun and whimsical.The reception we received at the front desk was lukewarm. Our server seemed to be having a bad day. Not bad service, just no warmth or personality. The cocktails were on the lower end of OK. The food was good, not great. The whole thing was just OK. I think if the hostess had seemed happy we were there, it would have started us on a better track. We wouldn't go back, but I guess it's worth one visit.
good place to hang out

Its' a pretty good place to stop in if you're into live music. The live music they have is fairly nice and the lasagna is also pretty good. All in all it's a nice place I would mind going back to every now and then.
I met a group of friends here for lunch on a Friday. Everything about it was a thumbs up except the parking. That was a nightmare. Lesson learned, choose a less popular day at the market.

3 stars is A Ok...I will give the pink door this.Wish I would have dressed up a little bit more though...beware.Appetizers were amazing. Drinks were phenomenal. I would try the lemon drop martini...Moving on to dinner - Ribs....Mmmmmmm BABY!The atmosphere is what I would say killed it a little for me...so A Okay brings it home!
I recommend eating outside during the summertime.
Soso, nice place but meal is not tasty
Honestly overhyped.
Really cool place, but too busy. Everyone seemed to just a bit overworked. Had some really good lasagna.
Awesome mid day drinks, surley hostess.
I don't quite know if I would recommend it. But it's so unusual, I think you have to try it for yourself. It is a one of a kind.

I'm really impressed with [Fast Food Restaurant]! The service is quick and efficient, and the food is always fresh and tasty. Great value for the money and consistently satisfying. Definitely a go-to spot for a fast and delicious meal!
great food and experience. have to make advance reservation it's a good part. food for simply delicious
I love Italian and this place did not disappoint my reasons why! The ambiance, the taste of the food and the smooth sounding entertainment!

This place is great! Atmosphere is chill and cool but the staff is also really friendly. They know what they're doing and what they're talking about, and you can tell making the customers happy is their main priority. Food is pretty good, some italian classics and some twists, and for their prices it's 100% worth it.
The food and service was excellent. It's not easy to find, but, it was worth of traveling to restaurant.

Nestled in the heart of Seattle, The Pink Door is a true gem among Italian restaurants. From the moment you step inside, you're greeted with the comforting aroma of fresh herbs and garlic, instantly transporting you to a cozy yet elegant, restaurant with perfect setting for a romantic dinner or a gathering with friends.The menu is a culinary journey through Italy, featuring authentic dishes bursting with flavor and made with the finest ingredients. Start your meal with the three meatballs or a delightful selection of cured meats, cheeses, and marinated vegetables. For the main course, the homemade pasta dishes are a must-try, especially the Pink Door lasagna. Each bite is a revelation, showcasing the skill and passion of the chefs.Pair your meal with a glass of wine from their extensive selection, expertly curated to complement the flavors of the food. Our waiter kept bringing us endless amounts of fresh bread with basil infused olive oil and balsamic. Don't forget to save room for dessert! I had the grapefruit marmalade cake with ginger whipped cream.But what truly sets The Pink Door apart is the impeccable service. The staff goes above and beyond to ensure that every guest feels welcome and cared for, adding a personal touch to the dining experience. Thank you Dan for being our waiter this afternoon!In conclusion, The Pink Door is a culinary masterpiece, offering an unforgettable taste of Italy right in the heart of Seattle. Whether you're a seasoned foodie or simply craving authentic Italian cuisine, this restaurant is sure to exceed your expectations. Buon appetito!
Great good and great service. I really like this place. One of my favorite places for dining.
Very good food and service! However, there was a bit wait time . I recommended this place
very nice, quick to serve food and clean. Nice staff. The food was also amazing and fresh. I love the name of the restaurant as well.

The calamari delivered a satisfying experience. The squid was perfectly cooked with a delightful crunch, and the accompanying sauce added a nice flavor boost. While not extraordinary, the dish was great overall, earning a solid 4-star rating. The service was prompt, and the restaurant's ambiance added to the positive dining experience.
Was so good! I just recently moved to the Seattle area and I will 100% be back. The atmosphere in combination to the entrees was amazing.
Good food, nice service, though I think it was too salty the food..... could be my impression. Other than that, I think all was great. My kids and I had great food and it is a nice place to go.
The food and cocktails were excellent. , the hostess was very helpful and our waitress, Abbey was fantastic! Highly recommend!
I went here with the hubby and it was a fantastic location for great food. The ambiance is unbeatable as well. Service was a little slow however.

1. "Fantastic dining experience! A hidden gem in the heart of the city. The food was exquisite, and the service was top-notch. I can't wait to go back!"2. "Great place to unwind! The atmosphere is cozy, and the staff is friendly. Their drink selection is impressive, and the live music was a pleasant surprise."3. "Outstanding customer service! The team went above and beyond to meet my needs. I'm very impressed with their professionalism and attention to detail."4. "A must-visit for art lovers! This gallery showcases a diverse range of talented artists. The exhibits are thought-provoking and beautifully curated. Truly inspiring!"
Good service and good food. Very busy when we were there and the staff did a good job managing that.
Good food and atmosphere! Fancy ambience
great service ambiance is nice
We loved everything we ate here. We were there around 11am and there was no live music. Our favorite thing was the appetizer.
delicious with wow service i want try again
The pappardelle bolognese here is my absolute favorite pasta dish I have had ever!!!!
Had a great evening at this place. Loved it overall.
Good food, good drinks. Been a few times. Been consistent. Only complaint is the wait. But good places mean you sometimes wait.
Delicious food and Good Environment.
Location and parking easy.Food good.Service good. Highly recommend!
Always a great spot. My wife and I have been going off and on for many years. Great Patio during the summer

Highly recommend. Great location. Solid bar program. Menu with great options. The space with outdoor seating was elegant. The tablecloths on the patio are low-end beyond being kitschy or campy. Otherwise would go back! I would love to return.

So excited that I finally got to try this restaurant and it definitely lived up to the hype! Hidden in an alley near Pike Market and only identifiable by their signature pink door, this restaurant feels like stepping into an old vaudeville theater. When we went, there was a live band with an amazing vocalist playing blues/Americana music. The pasta was good but the dishes could've used more sauce that was a consensus from all. The prices are affordable that's for sure. We stayed for a few hours, enjoyed the food, atmosphere, jazz band and company. The service could've been quicker but the waitress was extremely nice and knowledgeable. There's no reason why I wouldn't go back.

Highly recommend. Great location. Solid bar program. Menu with great options. The space with outdoor seating was elegant. The table cloths on the patio are low-end beyond being kitschy or campy. Otherwise would go back! I would love to return.
Great first date place! Great view. Great people! The food is just okay.

The gnocchi was kind of a weird mushy texture, the Bolognase was probably the best out of all the dishes we tried, it's definitely a beautiful place to have lunch/ dinner because of the views on the pier. Lots of windows by where we ate which was nice

Highly recommend. Great location. Solid bar program. Menu with great options. The space with outdoor seating was elegant. The table cloths on the patio are low-end beyond being kitschy or campy. Otherwise would go back! I would love to return.

My friends and I came here for dinner. The inside looks classy, very clean, and the lightning brings the area look more elegant! Our server was very accommodating and talkative. Everything was delicious, and the meals were pretty unique! We will try this place again!

I got a little incredulous about the eatery, the food showed up before long. I was amazed and believed that it should be old however it was new at my stun. I don't have the foggiest idea, perhaps I was overthinking. In any case, suggested. The pink door is a perfect spot to sit back relax and enjoy great food. This is one of my favorite spots

I personally know that this restaurant is expensive, but I had no idea what a small portion of the food is in this restaurant. I left the restaurant feeling a bit hungry. I am so satisfied with what I have experienced at this restaurant! They serve really great food and the ambiance of the restaurant is so fancy! I will surely recommend this restaurant to all my friends!

So I am down here cause this place looked nice to me and this was the best decision I made today. Great place to have lunch in peace. I was in stress all day but came here down and it calmed me a lot. Try as much as you can. The service was top notch, I will be back!

I've come here for the past three months and ordered the same dish over and over again. It reminds me of my mother's cooking, and she passed away last year. This place literally reminds me of a restaurant in my hometown my mother and I used to visit often. Whenever I start to miss my mom, I just come here.

At the end of every meal, I like to wind down my night with a coffee. Surprisingly, this place always brews my coffee fresh. Which a lot of places don't do. And I get a desert to pair with it nicely. I'd just like to say thank you for always providing great and consistent service. I would recommend this place to anyone.

I tried this place for the first-time last month. I've been here twice within the last week. My mission is to try everything on the menu here. This is my fifth time here and so far everything has been a hit. I recommend everybody to this place. I will come here once a month for the rest of my life. I'm not joking.

This is my go-to spot on late nights after the kid's games. After their games the kids are hangry and tired. So, the fact that they know my kids and make them feel so welcome is great. The food is consistent and tasty and comes out in a reasonable amount of time. I get my favorite drink and we all have a great time

I ordered take out from this place for my coworkers and I for lunch. We only have an hour to eat so I was hoping that everything would be ready so that we would have enough time to eat. Everything was ready, hot and they put extra condiments in. Will make this a regular thing.
The interior was nice and had a great ambiance. Our server was awesome and very attentive! The food was ok. I would go again for the right occasion.
Decent place to eat. I love pasta and wine and this is the place for it if you love both. Fresh ingredients and friendly staff.
Really good food outstanding service. The wine was the bomb diggity. No doubt.
Thanks The Pink Door I got the best experience here I like the food!
The place are do great I often to visit here because of food of course and the service!
Like the place and the food is delicious, I am grateful thanks!
I think the place is beautiful and the food as well are all good!
Great outdoor seating and nice music for drinks on weeknd nights.

We could not have been more delighted with our experience at The Pink Door. We found it by chance and it really does have a nondescript pink door. But when you walk inside, you get the feeling of warmth, history and elegance. The food was fantastic and they easily accommodated my no grain eating challenges. Their house infused olive oil was out of this world. We had filet of sole and a butternut squash risotto with shrimp. Could not have been better. We wanted to keep eating because it was so good but were full! Wait staff was friendly and attentive. Live music was fun on a Saturday night. We will be back!
Money super worth it! Very different and memorable experience. No review can give this place the justice is deserves. I highly recommend to try it for yourself.
had dinner there great restaurant
The food is just ok, but the service tends to be good and it has a good ambiance. It is good for a late night drink.
Cool old Seattle spot, classic food.

Always a great time out here!! But staff can be a little snooty. Thats the only downfall. Food is good and atmosphere is awesome. Especially on the patio that they have. Can be crowded so must prepare to wait.
Boom! I went on a Wed night and flavors were spot on.Service could improve though!
Love this place. You'll never get a bad meal here!

The squid ink pasta is amazing here !!! But parking is a pain in this area, so just beware. I would plan accordingly. Pay for parking as if you were planning on visiting the market as well as eat dinner.

My first time to come at the Pink door and I had great experiences. Delicious food, drinks and the ambience were wonderful and intimate. One of the best Italian menus I've ever seen and everything's looks delicious and well presented at a reasonable price. The service was good as well as the staff. Looking forward to coming back again.

Was a little intimidated to try the Pink Door. No signage. Entry weird. The service here was amazing. Our server was very accommodating and helpful. Interior neat, clean. Comfortable. Prices reasonable. Will definitely try again.

Always a great time and the family loves the lasagna. Great way to escape for a night out.Can be hard to make dining arrangements and have had hit and miss experiences with hosts, but worth the effort.

This spot is flavorful! The lasagna is beyond words. I additionally had shellfish, the fish tartar and some different applications. All stunning. The view is extremely lovely and notwithstanding discovering this spot is an adorable ordeal - locate the pink entryway in the rear way. One of a kind within and great nourishment and administration.
Good food. Great service. Fun place.

I love that how this place effortlessly makes someone feel at home. The environment was so good with delicious aromas of foods spread all over. Our ordered food was served so well and it was so appealing to my taste buds. Our server was very friendly. He gave us the details of all the dishes and so it was easy to decide then.

A significant fascinating section to this spot, we went hunting down a pink entryway with no sign. Had the lobster ravioli and the eggplant pasta for course. The administration was brisk, the server helped us pick sustenance. We finished supper on olive oil cake with orange and pomegranate sauce - it was immaculate! Provincial old fashioned feel, the unrecorded music after some time just develops the air! PS: Ask for the seat by the window, you may very well get it as we did ! :)
Good menu. Good Service. Good food. good location. What more is there to say?
Good food and good atmosphere. Good service. What more is there to say?
Great food and service I was here three times and will come again

Although a bit expensive because it is located in a touristy area, the food is delicious and so are the cocktails. The service was very friendly and the restaurant has great views. We did not need a reservation for a Friday afternoon. I would go back to try more dishes.
Although I didn't polish my plate, the lasagna was soft and cheesy.
the muscles the muscles and the sauce ...MMMM tastsy
Loved the lasagna! Tried a couple of the drinks and wasn't very impressed with either

Go to the Pink Door on a warm evening. These are pretty rare, but it's definitely worth spending one on the Pink Door's elevated patio. In fact, make an evening of it by putting on that swooshy little dress you paid too much for and a spritz of expensive perfume. I love their wild mushroom risotto and they make a damn good caesar too. Of course you will enjoy a glass of wine or other pretty drink, and your companion will find you enchanting.
So Good!That's all that i really want to add. So suck it up.
Great place for a nice date night. Wonderful staff.
Great food, a lot of fun, is a little slow. Give yourself plenty of time if you're planning on attending a show after dinner.
Great show! A great date night event
Really amazing food. Fun atmosphere, great live music. The service was amazing and we all enjoyed our meal.
A bit pricey but great atmosphere
super busy but love the vibe and environment
Really, go for the tapenade, the lemonade, and the summer deck seating.
Such a Seattle Staple.If you are there for me I am there or you!!Super good food!!!!!!!!!!

One of most vintage and collectively put together restaurants I have been to in Seattle. The simple but elegant aesthetic adds a nice touch to the vibe and provided my time there with relaxing energy. I indulged in the spaghetti with meatballs and enjoyed the simplicity in the flavors.Everything blended well and gave my palled a sweet but organic dance. The pricing is far and if you have dessert you're only coming out of your pocket about 40$. HIGHLY recommended!!!!
Amazing experience. Delicious food. Great service. Long wait(didn't have a reservation), WORTH THE WAIT.

Great overall experience. We started with the cheeseboard and it was the perfect start to the meal. I had the Linguine alle Vongole and the clams were so fresh it was one of the best linguine's I've had. My partner had the Lasagna, which he said was amazing. We were really pleased with this restaurant and definitely plan to come back on our next trip to Seattle.
If it wasn't for the Seattle traffic it would be 5 stars!!

Great atmosphere! Small jazz band trio was play on a Tuesday night. Loved the food and creative drink menu. We went back on another night since we liked this place so much. I also learned that they have acrobats that work the indoor swings on some evenings for added entertainment.

Love this place! Food is awesome and they provide decent service. I have had a few instances where the wait for food was a little long but besides that, I have had no issues. The food seems fresh and tastes delicious

Best Italian restaurant I have been to in Seattle! I came here and had the grilled Caesar salad and it's hands down the most delicious plate I've ever had. It was so good I couldn't even wait to take a picture. I also ordered the tuna tartare and shared the red sauce pasta! I'm so pleased with the quality of the food here. We also bought a bottle of Sangiovese and it was on point. Classy feel, classy restaurant! Such a great experience!!
Loved the cabaret with dinner, Fantastic, talented woman

I ordered the cioppino and my god, the broth was delicious. I eagerly asked our waitress for more bread so I can lap it all up. My girlfriend ordered the risotto which was so craftily made and had such exquisite flavor and wasn't overcooked nor undercooked but just right. For dessert we got the apricot and strawberry crumble which was too sweet, but thank god we had some ice cream to tone it down.

Excellent spot for a cocktail and a great atmospheres. Traveled here with some friends and this place was recommended by the hotel concierge and once we got there we knew why. Excellent selection and the bartenders knew what they were doing. They were very knowledgable and didn't have to stick to the menu, they offered to make anything with any individual ingredients that you like. Step right in and enjoy
great atmosphere, live music & shows some nights. super cool 'speakeasy' vibe though it's just down the alley from Pike Place

The Pink Door. I 'd been here once before, and had an excellent experience, so I convinced the group to check it out. As before, there was an accordion group, which totally rocked (we lucked out and got a table close to the stage). I went with the chilly dungeness crab dish, and between the four of us, we killed two bottles of wine, and totally enjoyed ourselves. Everyone adored their plates too, and the desserts were divine. Highly recommended.
so much funmust go at least once :)duhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh
Good food. GREAT atmosphere. Perfect for a date night.

One of a kind surroundings, as well as the vegetarian/pescatarian food collection is varied and delightful. Undoubtedly one of these areas which makes you feel as if you have finally found the city and broken out of the tourist routine, regardless of the closeness to Pike's Place I could not decide between 4 and 5 stars, but it gets five to counter all the whinging.

Burlesque, Italian food... what is not to like?!The patio in the back is where all the real action is (weather permitting). Decent views of the water and downtown.They have some vegan options here, which was a nice surprise (I am not Vegas but when going with friends). I am a big fan of the puttanesca.I have only seen the "show" once, and it was entertaining but the real star is the food.Its called the Pink door because, other than the pink door, you wouldn't know how to find the joint.The bar across the alley was a great place to go after to continue the celebrations. I am drawing a blank on the name.
Went there once, the entrance is literally a pink door and sit by the stage. The ambience is very cosy and the host is very friendly. Will come back for sure.

Visit the Pink Door on a warm evening. All these are quite uncommon, but it is definitely worth spending one on the Pink Door's raised veranda. Actually, make an evening of it by putting on that swooshy small clothing you paid too much for and a spritz of expensive cologne. I really like their wild mushroom risotto and they make a bloody great caesar also. Of course you may appreciate a glass of wine or another pretty beverage, as well as your company will see you enchanting.

Coming to this place was an interesting experience with the rustic pink door entrance. Plus knowing it was more of a pub it sort of threw the feel off. All the art on the walls and building was a please surprise and was excited about the whole place.The lasagna was fantastic and given the reviews from everyone else it's no suprise as well. Lasagna with some tabasco sauce makes it even better. Especailly with some heat makes the pallet just open up to bring the favor in that much more.

Really good food, great for a night out, can get pricey but the food is definitely worth it, in the summer you can sit on the balcony which is a huge plus, parking can be hard to find sometimes due to the prime location.
great food options. go there for happy hour! it is the best. some great shows are placed here too
Love Pink door. Jude is amazing!

I have lived in the Seattle area for quite some time yet had never been to the Pink Door. It was my birthday and my friends wanted something different than the usual so we tried it. Overall the food was good, all of our different wines were wonderful and we liked the atmosphere. We went on a Saturday evening so were able to watch the trapeze act. I'm told that they have 3 different trapeze acts a night but we only saw the first one. A little disappointing but still a unique experience. On Sundays they have a Vaudeville type of show that we haven't seen and may go back for that sometime. One note to others who have not been....there is no sign to indicate where the restaurant is outside. You enter from Post Alley and you must look for a kinda pink door to enter the Pink Door. Guess we should have read the yelp reviews before going :)
The veg lasagnas were great and surprising light!
Beautiful decor - my girlfriend and I loved this place. Everything was exceptionally good, from the food to the service. Very happy with my experience here.

DL: This place has consistently great pasta (not as great as Barolo, but pretty close). The entertainment can be fun. Their appetizers tend to be on the spot. They have nice hours (good for people who work late and whatnot).Pink Door has been a consistently good spot. The particular highlights have been the pasta and the appetizers. Their pappardelle ragu is great! Most often Pink Door has been delivered via Postmates. It's one of the most solid bets for Italian we've found for delivery.

It's been two months since my friends and I visited The Pink Door and my mouth is still watering whenever I think about how amazing the pesto lasagna was. I never thought a simple looking dish could taste that incredible. It's a must-order. The calamari was excellent as well. We assumed it was the usual deep fried dish but it wasn't. It was a nicely sauteed dish with garlic, tomatoes, spinach and white wine. When you enter through the pink door, you'll be mesmerized by how pretty the place is. It's an ambiance I'd imagine my reception to have if I had a small wedding party. The setting was whimsical, elegant and romantic.The back part of the restaurant has a more laid-back feel and is also where the bar is located! There's also an outdoor seating area - perfect to enjoy a meal with your S/O or friends.

You Gotta Go Once... this is one of those places that is the complete experience. Right from the start, the whole idea that there is no sign, just a pink door on an alley, gets you in the theme. It's not that hard to find if you pay attention, and look over the wall and see all the people dining on the deck that hangs over the water with an amazing view. Once inside, it's got that old Seattle brothel dcor, and if you time it right, a trapeze artist twirling around for her 5 minute performance every 30 minutes. If you book online, it's for seating outside. We were there during a rare heatwave, so outside at night was great. Perfect view of the water, the Great Wheel, and a cool statue on the neighbor's balcony next door.The service was good, friendly, attentive, informative. The food was tasty, but my two teenaged sons reported it was not enough food. They both ordered the Pappardelle, which was only that on a plate. I ordered a really juicy piece of freshly caught king salmon, and my husband ordered cioppino. My plate was the tastiest, simple and fresh. The cioppino was good, but neither a brothy soup or a plated dinner, it was somewhere in between.If you somehow book a table inside, it's more crowded, intimate, and entertaining for sure. On Saturdays they have a cabaret show, which is separate from the meal.
Great surprise. Ambiance was awesome glad we got in at the right time. Seafood was great and authentic.
Goto place when I'm in downtown... it never disappoints!
Great Italian food with classy ambiance!
Yup! It's good!
Fun, eclectic environment. Quite delicious

Service great, plenty of choices of wine (Italian and West Coast focused), and the food is always good (Some new items Every time). Their Cesar sounds so simple but its so good either add the shrimp or the crab. We tried the fish of the day and cioppino. Let me just say Seattle gets down with their see food. This place is always busy and they have live music almost everyday of the week. The entrance in an alley way so its fun to find. Close to Pike Market and Downtown. Very Romantic and from now on will make it a point to dine here every time I come to Seattle.
A must stop for me whenever I am in the area. Don't missed the Trapeze show. Great service, delicious food and an overall fun experience. Recommeneded for dates and birthdays

Took my wife here for our night out. Had an amazing time. The menu could of have a few more options, however all the food was good quality. I will for sure take my wife back in the summer for the out door seating our waiter mentioned to us. Slightly over priced so it is more of a special occasion restaurant. Parking around there was hard to find but I guess I have to expect that by pike place.
It was a great little out of the way place for lunch. Food was delicious and the server was very friendly. Will definitely come back.
I don't get this place. I mean the food wasn't bad, but I didn't see anything special. Definitely did enjoy the performance. I would give it a try one more time.
Huge servings and the food was really delicious.
Lobe the Pink Door! Went there for the first time in 5 years last week and it was still fantastic! What a unique and wonderful place to go and drink and eat. One of the very best in Seattle!
Been dining at The Pink Door from the time it opened. Consistently superb food, ambiance and staff. Always perfect for a special evening.
Very nice, cute and romantic... the food is awesome too!

We came here over the weekend with some out-of-towners, and wanted to give them a great dinner experience. This place delivered. We ended up splitting two appetizers, and I personally ordered the lasagna, and it was great. My wife really enjoyed her linguini and we all had a great time.The meal was a little pricey, but the atmosphere and the staff were wonderful. The performance was very entertaining as well, and it was worth the cost for such a great meal, and such a great time.
The pasta is divine!
love it the food. Very fresh seafood.
This place has great food and good entertainment. The price was a little high, even with a trapeze artist.
The short show is not bad. The food is not bad. But the cocktail is diluted.
Love the environment but the food is so so.
I've only been once and already remembered the address! It's just that good.

DELICIOUS! Everyone says this is a great date place, and it is, but it's also a great GNO (girl's night out) place! My bestie and I LOVED our experience. The waitstaff was attentive, the food was amazing. I highly recommend the pasta with bolognese sauce! YUM! And the trapeze artist....AMAZING!
The clams and mussels are amazing.
I always go back for their prosciutto, the best in town.
The art of burlesque dancing.
The food was very good and the ambiance was great, they had live music playing while I was thereThe service was good and I would go back again.
had an amazing experience
Great Italian food. You must try the rib-eye steak w/ black olive vinaigrette on a bed of arugula ~ smashed yukon gold potatoes & fresh herbs. YUMMY !!!!!!
Good food, good service, chic and cool atmosphere. I'd totally go back!
not the fanciest of settings, but a wonderful dining experience.
Excellent atmosphere and roasted garlic!
Get that Lasagna, yes it's vegetarian but just get it.
A Seattle gem. Too bad everyone knows about it. =T

I fell in love the first time I came here for lunch: summer, seated on the deck, Wine, caprese, beautiful view! I always take colleagues from out of town here, make sure you have reservations for a group. Saturday nights are super fun
Great patio with a great view.
really cute and comfortable atmosphere. great server (Denny) and great lasagna.

this place is awesome... i should give them 5 stars for the food and the environment.... but some of the waitresses there are not very polite. i took one star back. yes this is place is a place to eat and hang out if you have a chance to go Seattle...
This is still one of my favorite restaurants in Seattle with great food and ambiance and their outdoor deck is one of the best places to savor a sunny Seattle day.
All the great reviews say it well.....great spot with very good food
Good food, and nice atmosphere - what else could you ask for?
Really yummy food. Fun show. Great with friends. Just go! :)
Good stuff. Nice atmosphere.

The Pink Door is just glorious. It is beautiful in the summer and elegant in the winter. The bread is good to start with and their expresso is divine to end with. Try out the Lazagne-it is world famous and rightfully so-perfectly cooked, soft yet firm, creamy yet tangy. They have delicious daily specials and very friendly staff!
Amazing food and atmosphere. Service was wonderful. First time there will definitely go again

My family really enjoy the food and the vibe of the restaurant. My dining companion opted for the classic spaghetti carbonara, and it was delightfully creamy and savory, with just the right amount of pancetta. The staff was welcoming, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu. Our server provided excellent recommendations and checked in on us regularly without being intrusive. It's evident that they take pride in their food and service.

The Pink Door is an absolute gem in Seattle! From the moment we walked in, we were met with a warm and inviting atmosphere. Every dish was exquisite, made with high-quality ingredients and perfectly balanced flavors. The attention to detail in both the food and service made the experience truly special.To top it all off, the view was breathtaking--overlooking the ocean and the iconic Seattle Ferris wheel, creating the perfect backdrop for an unforgettable meal. If you're looking for exceptional Italian cuisine with a stunning ambiance, The Pink Door is a must!

The food here is nothing short of incredible. My friend ordered the lasagna, and I had to try it. We both agreed that it was, without a doubt, the best lasagna we've ever had--perfectly layered, flavorful, and just the right balance of textures. I ordered the pork chop dinner with cherry sauce, arugula, and potatoes, and I can honestly say it was the best pork chop I've ever had. The meat was perfectly cooked, tender, and juicy, and the cherry sauce was a delightful addition that brought the dish together. Every bite was perfection.The restaurant itself is decorated beautifully--cute and elegant, which just adds to the overall experience. We also found the prices to be quite reasonable, especially considering it's an upscale restaurant. Overall, this was an unforgettable dining experience, and I highly recommend it!
What a lovely place. Everything from the food, ambience , live music and service was special. I can't wait to come back.
So cute and great food! I loved the whole experience. I will be going back as soon as i can!
Wonderful meal (pasta!) and great service. We had a great view of the bay down below. It's worth the wait in line.
Haven't been back in years but we just made a reservation. I've been dreaming about their Branzino! Can't wait to get there!!
I love the food, and the place has a very relaxing vibe. It's always one of my top choices when dining with family.

What a wonderful experience. This place was recommended by several different people and it was definitely a great recommendation. The food was amazing and the service was excellent. The location has a great vibe and beautiful decor. Definitely recommend when visit g the area.

My garlic bread needs to come grilled for the rest of my life now. Everything was great. But I got the lasagna which was delicious but small and I was still hungry after. The rigatoni with mamas meatballs was delicious but more on the Al dente side than we wanted. The meatball I thought it was just ok. But it's a popular dish. And the rose hips to my lips was really sweet but tasty.
wow Such a good food. Honestly the best restaurant in Seattle.The yellowtail tuna is my favorite dish over there and then you have the lasagna that you have to try. Highly recommended.
An excellent location, especially sitting by the windows. More expensive than we were set out to spend. But, the food and the service were excellent.

I was told about Pink Door by several people and decided to give it a try, it did not disappoint. Pink Door impresses with its thoughtfully crafted dishes and inviting atmosphere. The Ahi Tuna Crudo was fresh and bright and was complemented by fried capers and microgreens, creating a balanced plate with delightful textures and flavors. The Lasagna Pink Door, rich with spinach and perfectly melted cheese, exceeded my expectations despite not being a huge lasagna fan. The Lemon Risotto with Prawns had a bright, lemony taste that wasn't overpowering. The creamy risotto was decadent yet light, while the prawns were large, flavorful, and juicy. For dessert, the Tiramisu was creamy with soft, spongey ladyfingers and a pleasant coffee taste. The Espresso Martini, though smooth and potent, left me wishing for a creamier texture, but that's personal preference. Reservations can be hard to come by, but walk-ups are an option if you're willing to wait. The beautifully decorated interior and attentive, friendly service make Pink Door a charming spot worth the effort to visit.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Pink Door in Seattle, and it was an exceptional experience. Our waitress, Krista, did an excellent job recommending meals, appetizers, and drinks. She was attentive, ensuring our waters were always filled, which added to the overall positive experience.The ambiance was wonderfully relaxing, enhanced by a beautiful view of The Sound and West Seattle. The setting alone makes this place worth visiting.Now, onto the food. The lemon risotto is a must-try; it's perfectly balanced and flavorful. The crab and corn salad appetizer is another standout, bringing the freshness of Northwest crab right to your table. However, the oil served with the bread could be improved; it's a bit lacking for dipping six pieces of bread. A little more oil would go a long way.Despite this minor detail, Pink Door is a must-go destination. Just be sure to look for the huge line, as the entrance can be easy to miss.---
I've never been to Seattle WA or this restaurant 5 stars yippy Kaya yippyly doo I love food

I was told about this restaurant from a colleague and it was just as good as he said it would be! The atmosphere is fabulous, the food is delicious and fresh and the staff is both knowledgeable and friendly. This is a place to go if you'd like to relax and enjoy a great meal!
Great food, great music, great service while the place looked great inside. Loved this place!
He completes his work very well and I have also got a lot of comfort through him. I really satisfied with the service.

Food:The Pink Door is renowned for its authentic Italian cuisine, featuring a diverse menu that celebrates fresh, locally sourced ingredients. Highlights include handmade pasta dishes like the signature lasagna and fettuccine with wild mushrooms as well as hearty meat and seafood entres. The food is expertly prepared with attention to flavors and presentation, appealing to both traditional Italian cuisine enthusiasts and adventurous foodies alike.Service:The service at The Pink Door is attentive and friendly, reflecting a genuine passion for the hospitality. Staff members are knowledgeable about the menu offerings and are quick to offer recommendations or accommodate special requests. The overall atmosphere is relaxed yet professional, contributing to a pleasant dining experience.Conclusion:For a taste of Italy in heart of Seattle.The Pink Door exceeds expectations with its delightful ambiance and delectable cuisine. Whether you're a local or a visitor, dining at The Pink Door is a culinary experience not to be missed.

The ambience, food, service, everything was amazing!!! My fianc got the bolognese and it was so flavorful and I got the beef rib which was the best thing I ate in Seattle! I definitely recommend this spot if you visit Seattle because this place alone made the trip worth it!
Customer service was excellent and food was delicious. Little hard to find but overall highly recommend

Everything about this place was great. Our server was very kind. They did forget the appetizer that we ordered but they apologized after and had it be on the house. The lamb chops were to die for. So good. It is so moist and tender. Their cocktails were balanced and attention to detail was noticed. An Italian soda is also recommended! You will have a pleasant experience dining here!
Thank you Mike. The service was amazing. The price was excellent. Very highly recommend thank you

Title: A DeliciousNestled in the heart of downtown Seattle, this pasta haven is a true gem for any culinary enthusiast. From the moment you step inside, you're greeted with a warm and inviting atmosphere that sets the stage for an unforgettable dining experience.The service here is impeccable, with attentive staff members who go above and beyond to ensure your satisfaction. Whether it's recommending the perfect wine pairing or accommodating dietary restrictions, they handle every request with grace and professionalism.Now, let's talk about the star of the show: the famous Pink Door lasagna. It's not just a dish; it's a masterpiece. Each layer is lovingly crafted with the finest ingredients, creating a symphony of flavors that dance on your palate with every bite. From the rich tomato sauce to the creamy ricotta cheese,spinach in every element is perfectly balanced, leaving you craving more with each forkful.But the excellence doesn't stop there. Every dish on the menu is a testament to the chef's skill and dedication to authentic Italian cuisine. Whether you opt for the classic spaghetti carbonara or indulge in the decadent fettuccine Alfredo, you're guaranteed a culinary journey that will transport you straight to the streets of Italy.In conclusion, if you find yourself craving a taste of Italy in the heart of Seattle, look no further than this pasta paradise. With its welcoming ambiance, top-notch service, and mouthwatering dishes, it's a dining experience that will linger in your memory long after the last bite. Highly recommended for pasta aficionados and foodies alike!
Place is great my son goes there , they're really dedicated with every aspect, all of the stuff is really dedicated
Great place! Amazing food. Excellent service. Will be back. Highly recommend if you're on the area.
Never disappoints! I've been here multiple times and the food and service is always on point!
The most amazing food ever! And also the staff is so nice to everyone. I highly recommend buying food from here...
Love this place Great food always fresh Amazing atmosphere Perfect customer service

cant find anything negative really to say everything is nice from the food the service and the vibe of the place! prices are reasonable also especially for Seattle. sometimes there is waiting but totally worth it to be honest!

Great lemon drop martini and great space after a long day of wine tasting. Did not want any more wine and pasta was perfect - we were here 10 years ago and they have made a bigger space. Less romantic but very fun
Food was great, the drinks were really good and the service was excellent! Would definitely recommend this place !
Always great service and food. Need to make rest in advance. Greta date spot. Whole rock fish was amazing.
Great food great atmosphere the the pastas are great and the limoncello and the tiramisu is to die for
This place has the view, the vibe, and the charm. The food is delicious, the ambience is hypnotic. I love this place!

Fun, trendy atmosphere with live shows that vary nightly. The music was unfortunately very loud (bordering on too loud) in the front room and not audible in the back room. The mushroom pasta was a bit too salty for me but I highly recommend the lasagna which was light and airy with a thin layer of tomato sauce on top. The bread pudding and budino were also excellent.

A little hard to find at first, but the atmosphere is fun and the drinks were amazing! The food was so good too. We sat outside and watched the sunset over the sound. The wait staff was very friendly and the service was fast!
Amaazing food! The whole experience from start to finish is great waitress is always so friendly and kind.

Finding the place is half the fun! The risotto and olives under my fish were exceptional contributions and not an afterthought to the delicious entree. Best dessert I've ever had, get the Butterscotch.
Great scenery and environment. We sat outside on the patio. Lasagna is the best I've ever had. Large selection of food items. Great drink menu and desserts. Highly recommend.

A Culinary Extravaganza at Pink Door: A Gem Near Pike Place MarketRating: Nestled near Pike Place Market in Seattle, the Pink Door restaurant stands as a shining gem in the city's culinary landscape. Boasting delicious Italian fare, impeccable service, and a delightful array of drinks, the Pink Door provides a dining experience that is nothing short of exceptional.The heart of any restaurant is its cuisine, and the Pink Door excels in delivering an Italian culinary experience that is second to none. From the moment you take your first bite, you are transported to the rustic kitchens of Italy, where flavors are bold, ingredients are fresh, and each dish tells a story. The menu showcases a thoughtful selection of traditional Italian favorites, expertly crafted with a modern twist. Whether it's the velvety pasta dishes, flavorful antipasti, or the mouthwatering desserts, every item on the menu is a testament to the culinary artistry of the chefs.Complementing the delectable cuisine is the outstanding service that the Pink Door is renowned for. The staff is not only attentive and professional but also exudes a genuine warmth that adds to the overall charm of the dining experience. From recommendations tailored to your preferences to a seamless flow of service, the team at Pink Door ensures that every guest feels pampered and valued.The libations at Pink Door deserve special mention, as they add an extra layer of sophistication to the dining affair. The drink menu is a carefully curated selection of wines, cocktails, and spirits that perfectly complement the flavors of the cuisine. Whether you're a wine enthusiast or prefer a craft cocktail, the Pink Door has a libation to suit every palate.Beyond the culinary delights, the Pink Door also offers a captivating atmosphere. The restaurant's interior is a blend of classic Italian charm and artistic flair, with live performances ranging from cabaret to trapeze acts adding an extra layer of entertainment. The ambiance is vibrant and inviting, creating an unforgettable dining experience that lingers in your memory.The Pink Door near Pike Place Market in Seattle is more than just a restaurant; it's a culinary gem that sparkles with authenticity, flavor, and warmth. From the mouthwatering Italian dishes to the impeccable service and captivating atmosphere, the Pink Door captures the essence of an extraordinary dining experience. If you're in search of a place where delicious food, great service, and wonderful drinks converge, the Pink Door is a must-visit destination.

This cozy restaurant has left the best impressions! Hospitable hosts, delicious dishes, beautiful presentation, wide wine list and wonderful dessert. I recommend to everyone! I would like to come back here again and again.

The ambiance is truly elegant and upscale. With stunning views overlooking the "fish cleaning area" near Pike Place Market, the scenery is simply breathtaking. Additionally, the forthcoming park being constructed across the street promises to enhance the already picturesque environment even further. The food was delicious, and the service was impeccable. I highly recommend requesting a window table to fully enjoy the magnificent views.
Everything was good. food, service, drinks ambiance. All in all very classy place. The fresh mozzarella is amazing so are the drinks

Very friendly staff, the place is quite aesthetic and the ambiance is top tier for me. But you have to book a reservation a month or two before your expected date. The food wasn't too bad, probably needs more work but overall I think this is quite good especially for two.
I was served by a beautiful woman named Raluca. Best service I have ever had! reserve your table with her!

Tasty birthday lunch for my business partner today! Cold and rainy outside but warm and friendly inside. Sat next to the big windows looking out on Sound and mountains. Had the holiday spritz, was so good with a white vermouth and aperol! Rice ball appetizer was delicious. We shared a couple pasta dishes and they did not disappoint. First time dining at Pink Door and would love to go again, if I can ever snag a reservation! Service was friendly and prompt, very chill waiter with all the hustle and bustle of a busy restaurant.

Wonderful! It was a sunny day and pink door was bustling! Started with a nice appetizer that was like a charcuterie board on a plate. The scallops were amazing. The risotto with beef was too cheesy for me and the waiter kindly replaced it with squid ink pasta which I gobbled down. Our plates were clean! Delish. Great place to treat yo self.

We loved The Pink Door! This was recommended to us and it didn't disappoint. Loved the vibe of the restaurant and the aerial show was so unique! The food and cocktails were excellent. Taylor, the hostess was very helpful and our waitress, Abbey was fantastic! Highly recommend!
Great ambiance and location Food is good too but the full package extraordinary :):)
your so cheesy my bluetiful
We really enjoyed our first time eating at the Pink Door and can't wait to go again!!!

column3: Luis Moreno Y Sus Compas M.
column8: muy buena comida 100x100 recomedados muy amables estn haciendo un buen trabajo en su negocio

Fabulous place! We used to come here with my partner and it was our haven, we returned there tonight after a long time and we completely forgot how amazing it is here! The restaurant's ambiance is a harmonious blend of sophistication and relaxation, creating an atmosphere perfect for unwinding.The staff are nice and attentive, no complains on service, even though they were busy we didn't feel rushed. The food was delicious and we were lucky to squeeze in some shared desserts. Thoroughly enjoyed the food.It was so lovely and l enjoyed my time there. We will be coming back soon again!

I visited The Pink Door recently and was thoroughly impressed! The food was a delightful journey of flavors, each dish beautifully presented and bursting with freshness. The service was impeccable, with attentive and friendly staff who made our dining experience truly special. As for the ambiance, it was enchanting - the chic decor and cozy atmosphere created the perfect backdrop for an unforgettable evening. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a top-notch dining experience!
My favorite place to treat myself and my guests, after checking out pike place market.
Brought my wife here for our anniversary!! She loves it. Will come back again definitely!!!! Yummy food!!
Husband and I had a date night here. So small and intimate. The wine paired meal was exceptional. Parking sucks but everything else is killer!
Loved the food , liked the place, the waitress was very nice and professional too. I think her name was Natalie. Will be back for sure
great food, liked a lot the service and cleanliness of the place. Good place to go with family

The food and drinks are great! The clam pasta and grilled whole fish were amazing. Green salad and antipasto were great. Service was friendly and we were well treated. The only thing that didn't meet my expectation was the chairs. They were too high for the tables so you tend to bend your back while having food.

The Pink Door: A Seattle GemNestled in the heart of Seattle, The Pink Door is a culinary gem. From the lively cabaret-style atmosphere to the delectable Italian fare, every aspect is a testament to the restaurant's charm. Pasta Perfection: 5/5The handmade pasta stole the show--cooked al dente and adorned with rich, flavorful sauces. The signature lasagna was a highlight, showcasing a perfect blend of textures and tastes. Entertainment Extravaganza: 4.5/5The live cabaret performances added a unique touch, enhancing the overall dining experience. A delightful blend of music, comedy, and skilled acrobatics created an entertaining backdrop. Wine Wonderland: 4/5The extensive wine list complements the Italian menu splendidly. A diverse selection of reds and whites caters to varied preferences, though a few more affordable options would be appreciated. Ambiance and Views: 5/5The enchanting decor, coupled with views of Pike Place Market and Elliott Bay, creates a magical setting. Ideal for both intimate dinners and celebratory gatherings.In a nutshell, The Pink Door offers a quintessential Seattle dining experience--a perfect fusion of exceptional cuisine, vibrant entertainment, and captivating views. A must-visit for those seeking an unforgettable taste of Italy in the heart of the Emerald City.

We loved The Pink Door! This was recommended to us and it didn't disappoint. Loved the vibe of the restaurant and the aerial show was so unique! The food and cocktails were excellent. Taylor, the hostess was very helpful and our waitress, Abbey was fantastic! Highly recommend!
Great Italian food, very unique place. Had the lasagna was unique and very good. You may miss the door....
Never disappoints with the seafood dishes. Havent had the pasta dishes yet but the seafood is amazing.

An extremely posh place to have italian cuisine. Good to have reservations for this place. It had good vegetarian options as well as a good selection of drinks to choose from. I had the corn of the cob and lasagna. I would recommend the place to anyone. It is a bit of road and can be difficult to spot but worth the vibe, ambience and experience!
